title: Saint Etienne - Too Young to Die (Singles 1990-1995) @320
description:
Saint Etienne -  Too Young to Die (Singles 1990-1995)

REVIEW
Although their albums were considerably more consistent than most dance-pop acts, Saint Etienne\&#039;s high points were always their singles. Released prior to a quiet, lengthy hiatus, Too Young to Die collects all of their singles, from their debut disco cover of Neil Young\&#039;s \"Only Love Can Break Your Heart\" to their last, \"He\&#039;s on the Phone,\" providing a thoroughly entertaining chronicle of the group\&#039;s career. Much of the music sounds somewhat dated -- which is always a problem with dance music -- but Saint Etienne was essentially a very good Euro-pop band, reveling in kitsch and style in equal measure. At their best -- \"Only Love Can Break Your Heart,\" \"You\&#039;re in a Bad Way,\" \"Join Our Club,\" \"Who Do You Think You Are,\" among others -- they found the heart in nightclubbing. The quality of the music dips slightly in the latter half of the album, but there is prime pop throughout the disc.   AMG
